summary:
This was mostly a ceremonial meeting with several presentations and recognitions rather than major policy decisions.

**KEY DECISIONS**
• Confirmed Hyman Moore as the new Los Angeles Fire Chief (unanimous 12-0 vote)
• Approved item 6 regarding short-term rental regulations (11-0, with one recusal)
• Passed a motion on menopause workplace support policies

**NOTABLE DISCUSSIONS**
• Extensive Veterans Day presentations honoring military service members who work for the city
• Council Member Yaroslowski led a presentation on World Day of Remembrance for road traffic victims, highlighting LA's failure to meet Vision Zero goals (traffic deaths up 20% from 2017-2021)
• Transgender Awareness Month proclamation introduced by Council Members Hernandez and Hut
• Public safety concerns raised about Chief McDonald's handling of protests

**BOTTOM LINE**
The council confirmed a new fire chief and spent most of the meeting on ceremonial business honoring veterans and raising awareness about traffic safety. The most significant action was appointing Moore to lead LAFD during a challenging time following recent wildfire responses.
